definition: to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: Listen to the reports, know the landscape, plug your ears, and go on ahead.
sentences.chinese: 听听报道，了解地形，塞住耳朵，然后勇往直前。

sentences.english: Don't loiter ; keep moving ; it may rain to-morrow.
sentences.chinese: 别虚度光阴，勇往直前，就算明天会下雨。

sentences.english: Go forth to meet the shadowy Future, without fear, and with many a heart.
sentences.chinese: 满怀信心，勇往直前，迎接迷朦的未来。

sentences.english: YOS, in particular, should spare no efforts to push forward.
sentences.chinese: 黄老鞋尤其应该不遗余力勇往直前。

sentences.english: Life sometimes buffets you forward, as it happens.
sentences.chinese: 生活有时碰巧会激发你勇往直前。
她能勇往直前毫无惧色。

sentences.english: I admire Steve so much for pushing forward.
sentences.chinese: 我非常佩服史蒂夫的勇往直前。

sentences.english: Literal-minded answer, a straight-ahead answer like that.
sentences.chinese: 答案，一个勇往直前的回答如此。

sentences.english: YOS（Yellow Old Shoes)，in particular, should spare no efforts to push forward.
sentences.chinese: 黄老鞋尤其应该不遗余力勇往直前。

sentences.english: It's time to take your courage in your hands and start talking -- to each other.
sentences.chinese: 所以是时候勇往直前，彼此开始亲密接触了。

sentences.english: Where there is a will there is a way. Will is power.
sentences.chinese: 勇往直前，言出必行，走别人不一样的路。

definition: see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
see 百折不撓|百折不挠[bai3 zhe2 bu4 nao2]
